that is a beauty!:eek:  very reasonably priced......a very odd factory magenta ghost.....good luck with the sale my friend:)
Thanks guys.  Don't get excited - it's just a color shift;i.e-not fvcked-up enough to have any real value.

[quote name="Runscott" post=1453744]Thanks guys.  Don't get excited - it's just a color shift;i.e-not fvcked-up enough to have any real value.[/QUOTE]

I don't know Scott. Seems pretty fvcked up to me. I don't see a speck of gold on that T205 border.

[quote name="bnorth" post=1453794]I don't know Scott. Seems pretty fvcked up to me. I don't see a speck of gold on that T205 border.[/QUOTE]

The story of getting that card slabbed is mind-numbing.  I attempted to get it done in person at the 2013 Chicago show.  I handed the card to SGC and they said that they would certainly mention the ghosting, but the next day when I went to pick it up, it wasn't done and they said they would NOT say anything about the ghost.  I argued with them repeatedly about it each time I went to pick it up, but in the end all they could do was fvck up the label.

I was so focused on the fact that the label didn't mention the ghost, that I never noticed it said T205.  I didn't realize it until someone here pointed it out earlier this year.

Still, when I 'need' cards slabbed, I go to SGC.  They are like Jesus Montero, Mike Zunino and several other Mariners that can't quite get it done - loads of potential for way too many years.  It time for them to either start performing or be put on waivers.
